definitions.definition: Anything movable (a good ) that is bought and sold .
Raw materials , agricultural and other primary products as objects of large-scale trading in specialized exchanges .
examples: The price of crude oil is determined in continuous trading between professional players in World's many commodities exchanges.

definitions.definition: Undifferentiated goods characterized by a low profit margin and (usually) fungibility , as distinguished from branded products not wholly fungible.
examples: Although they were once in the forefront of consumer electronics, the calculators have become a mere commodity .

definitions.definition: Anything which has both a use value and an exchange value .

main_definition: ( business ) Anything movable (a good ) that is bought and sold . [from 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( economics ) Raw materials , agricultural and other primary products as objects of large-scale trading in specialized exchanges .
( marketing ) Undifferentiated goods characterized by a low profit margin and (usually) fungibility , as distinguished from branded products not wholly fungible.
( Marxism ) Anything which has both a use value and an exchange value .
( obsolete ) Self-interest ; personal convenience or advantage . [16th–19th c.]
